questions.question: What is a hominin?

choices.answer: an early ancestor of humans
the full skeleton of a human
any ape species from Africa
a very advanced human

questions.question: What is one important clue the Leakeys found about Homo habilis (Handy Man)?

choices.answer: They could make and use tools.
They lived very short lives.
They had hands like an ape's.
They were not bipedal.

questions.question: The one main difference Upright Man had from Handy Man is the they were shorter.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: The hominin group Homo neanderthalensis is the

choices.answer: large-brained group closely related to modern humans
last group of hominins that had a hunched body
tall ape group that existed before modern humans
first hominin to migrate and settle in new areas

questions.question: Which of the following is true of Homo sapiens (Wise Man)?

choices.answer: They were more physically adapted to the cold out of any hominin
They were more skilled at making their own tools than Neanderthals
They were extraordinarily talented blacksmiths, welders, and builders
They were the first hominin group to work together in communities

questions.question: If your profession is to study the development and culture of early hominins, then you are most likley

choices.answer: a historian
an archaeologist
a geographer
an anthropologist

questions.question: Homo habilis's ability to make tools affected their lives by isolating them from animals.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: The biggest advantage of hominins in the Homo erectus (Upright Man) group was their ability to

choices.answer: work with fire
tame horses
make clothes
trade items

questions.question: Neanderthals were skilled tool makers mostly because of their

choices.answer: impressive physical strength
tall figure, and long limbs
large brains, and intelligence
gigantic hands, and thick skin

questions.question: How did the prehistoric humans' inventions of the spear thrower and the bow and arrow affect their hunting?

choices.answer: It helped them hunt from a distance, which made hunting safer
It made them eat less vegetation, which helped the environment
It helped them examine animals, allowing them to study anatomy
It caused them to eat too much meat, making many species extinct

questions.question: What does the word paleo mean?

choices.answer: bone
historian
ancient
skeleton

questions.question: What evidence suggests that Homo habilis (Handy Man) lived in groups?

choices.answer: Tools were found next to a Handy Man skeleton
Bones from more than one Handy Man were found together.
Scientists have discovered Handy Man remains only in Europe
Cave art and paintings have been found near Handy Man remains

questions.question: Scientists believe that the Upright Man group's ability to move places, use fire, and build shelters helped them

choices.answer: develop their own language and speech
travel across the ocean to live on islands
survive longer than other hominins could
form complex trade and barter systems

questions.question: Which of the following is true of Neanderthals?

choices.answer: Neanderthals were much taller and thinner than early humans
Neanderthals spoke languages similar to early human languages
Neanderthals lived among early humans for around 10,000 years.
All of them

questions.question: How do scientists believe hominins in the Homo sapiens (Wise Man) group were able to migrate to North and South America?

choices.answer: They constructed ships made out of wood and very hard clay
They traveled land bridges that are now covered by water.
They canoed to islands, and eventually reached the Americas
They built man-made bridges across various bodies of water

questions.question: The Leakeys named their 1960 discovery Homo habilis (Handy Man) to honor the group's capability to

choices.answer: create art
farm crops
hunt animals
make tools

questions.question: What is one way Homo habilis (Handy Man) was similar to modern humans?

choices.answer: They were about the same height as modern humans
They could only get food by hunting and gathering
They could speak a simple language and read symbols
They were biped, meaning they could walk on two legs

questions.question: Scientists believe that hominins in the Homo erectus (Upright Man) group were the first to

choices.answer: migrate out of Africa
walk using two feet
sing songs together
eat animal meat

questions.question: What is one reason scientists believe Neanderthals had a sense of community?

choices.answer: They formed troops and battled each other
They buried the dead in burial grounds
They wrote simple stories and poems
They built structures similar to castles

questions.question: The prehistoric humans' artwork suggests that they

choices.answer: spoke a developed language
wrote treaties and agreements
designed intricate battle plans
communicated their feelings
